description: From Latin līminālis, from līmen (“doorstep, threshold; doorway, entrance; beginning, commencement”) + -ālis (suffix forming adjectives of relationship from nouns). Līmen is possibly derived from līmus (“askew; sideways”) (possibly ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *Heh₃l- (“to bend, bow; elbow”)) + -men (suffix forming neuter nouns of the third declension) (from Proto-Indo-European *-mn̥ (suffix forming action nouns or result nouns from verbs)).

adjectives.description: liminal (comparative more liminal, superlative most liminal)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to an entrance or threshold. [from late 19th c.]
Of or pertaining to a beginning or first stage of a process. [from late 19th c.]
